newsitem.title: UK: IPE gas oil ends lower but key supports holding.
newsitem.headline: IPE gas oil ends lower but key supports holding.

text.p: IPE gas oil futures ended slightly weaker after Brent futures retraced afternoon short-covering lead gains, but traders said both markets were technically well supported and fundamentally underpinned.

They said talk that Iraq and the U.N. may resolve the oil for food aid plan and a bearish U.S. stocks report were countered by tighter European supplies of both crude and products and this combined with some stiff trendline resistance was putting a solid bottom in the market.
July gas oil last traded 25 cents down at $162.75 a tonne with July Brent off 23 cents at $18.15 a barrel.
Both contracts were holding key support at $162.25 a tonne and $18.11 a barrel respectively.
Short-covering just before the NYMEX opening and following a report that European crude and products stocks had fallen in June pushed both markets sharply higher.
Brent cut through a wide band of resistance between $18.24 up to a brief break of $18.40 a barrel and gas oil bounced off resistance at $164 a tonne.
But sentiment turned weaker again and selling pressure pushed both markets back down to test what are proving to be strong support levels again.
